channel.title: Getting to sleep
channel.description: I can't fucking sleep this summer. I'm up to like 3-6 in the morning and then sleep to like 1-5 pm. I try to sleep but then I just end up not being able to sleep and eating or watching tv or going on computer or something. Like right now it's 3:30 and I should be sleeping but I can't. Any tips on how the hell to get to sleep?

item.title: Getting to sleep
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:5, topic:130164”]Try going to bed “early” one night (early in your case could qualify as 1:00 am) and wake up early…like 6:30-7:00. Then you’ll naturally start feeling tired by 11:00. If you want to get back on routine, however, you have to consistently do that. The first couple days you still probably won’t feel like sleeping, but hold to it and you’ll get there. That’s the easiest way I know of to get back on a routine.[/quote]and if that doesnt work, do the opposite, try to stay up until your normal sleeping time

Read full topic

item.title: Getting to sleep
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Try going to bed “early” one night (early in your case could qualify as 1:00 am) and wake up early…like 6:30-7:00. Then you’ll naturally start feeling tired by 11:00. If you want to get back on routine, however, you have to consistently do that. The first couple days you still probably won’t feel like sleeping, but hold to it and you’ll get there. That’s the easiest way I know of to get back on a routine.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting to sleep
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I have this all the time, dosen’t matter what I do in the daytime, I can skip nights, try and force myself into “proper” times, etc. - I always revert to 4am-midday ish.

It’s just the way some people are, if the above suggestions don’t work for you, just learn to live with it

PS. Read http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circadian_rhythm_sleep_disorder

Read full topic

item.title: Getting to sleep
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

You need to start doing some stuff during the day. Or do what Kane said.
I some times get that. I can’t fall asleep, then the next afternoon I just train etc, and fall asleep.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting to sleep
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

You’re sleeping patterns are out of whack.
What i do when that happens to me (Normally after holidays of staying up till 7am and sleeping till 4pm) is either stay up the whole night, the whole morning and try to sleep at like 9pm the next day.

It’s hard but you have to keep yourself occupied.
Or wear yourself out by running around all day and fall asleep at an appropriate normal time.

Read full topic
